page.title: 14Winford Manor
page.content: Winford Manor is 3/4 of a mile from Winford village,in a densly wooded coppice. The 19th Century Manor house was built by the Cripps family,Lords of the Manor who owned Felton Common.They are believed to be relatives of Captain Mark Phillips,the husband of Princess Anne. During the 1st World War the Parish Council was appointed Lord of the Manor,and the house and land were bought by Captain Harvey who started poultry farming,later operated by Lyditte Chicks. The property is now owned by a Mr George,and the house is divided into five flats.The wooden outbuildings, showing signs of the older poultry business,are still there,but are beginning to look rather derelict.
